title: webdav empty userid in apache logs
body:
i have been having issues getting webdav to work reliably with owncloud. it works with some clients, like the owncloud clients, and others such as some apps on my phone. however webdav does not work on other clients on the same devices. i have been trying to nail this problem down for months with no luck, so i figured it was time to submit a ticket.
it seems from what i have found, that whenever i run into a problem where a client cannot complete an action over webdav, the userid field in the apache log is empty, whereas when a client can complete an action, the userid field is populated. i am not sure what is causing this.
i am running a self hosted version - 5.0.8, but have been having the issue since before i upgraded to the major release 5. 
i have used both debian 6.0.3 & 6.0.7.
i have the following packages installed that have any relation to apache or php
apache2
apache2-mpm-prefork
apache2-utils
apache2.2-bin
apache2.2-common
libapache2-mod-php5
php-pear
php-xml-parser
php5
php5-cli
php5-common
php5-gd
php5-ldap
php5-mysql
php5-suhosin

an example from the apache log of a request that did not work,
xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx - - [19/may/2013:21:24:41 -0300] "propfind /remote.php/webdav/clientsync http/1.1" 401 5503 "-" "csyncoc/0.70.6 neon/0.29.6"
and the immediate subsequent request with the userid field populated that did work
xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx - braxton [19/may/2013:21:24:41 -0300] "propfind /remote.php/webdav/clientsync http/1.1" 207 4586 "-" "csyncoc/0.70.6 neon/0.29.6"

then the two apps i use to sync my photos off my phone, where one works, and the other does not,
this one does not
xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx - - [19/may/2013:21:07:32 -0300] "put /braxton's%20iphone/2013-02-03%20at%2012.05.52.jpg http/1.1" 405 644 "-" "camerasync/500 (iphone; ios 6.1.3; scale/2.00)"
and this one does
xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx - braxton [19/may/2013:21:19:51 -0300] "put /remote.php/webdav/photosync/braxton's%20iphone/camera%20roll/img_1535.jpg http/1.1" 201 628 "-" "photosync/1.7.3 cfnetwork/609.1.4 darwin/13.0.0"
